front.div:
Abstract
Over the past decades, there have been significant efforts on
developing robust and easy-to-use query interfaces to
databases. So far, the typical query interfaces are GUI-
based visual query interfaces. Visual query interfaces
however, have limitations especially when they are used for
accessing large and complex datasets. Therefore, we are
developing a novel query interface where users can use
natural language expressions to help author visual queries.
Our work enhances the usability of a visual query interface
by directly addressing the "knowledge gap" issue in visual
query interfaces. We have applied our work in several
real-world applications. Our preliminary evaluation
demonstrates the effectiveness of our approach.
